context: A mixture of itaconic acid (1.3 g, 10 mmol) and p-chlorobenzylamine (1.28 ml, 11 mmol) was stirred at 120 °C for 4 hours. Thereafter, the solvent was evaporated off under reduced pressure, and the obtained crystals were washed with a mixed solution of acetic acid and hexane (1:9) to obtain the title compound (2.3 g, yield 92%).
gold_antecedents: A mixture of itaconic acid (1.3 g, 10 mmol) and p-chlorobenzylamine (1.28 ml, 11 mmol)

context: 1-Fluoro-3-iodopropane (40.9 μL, 0.39 mmol) was added to a solution of N-(4-((6S,8R)-7-((1-fluorocyclopropyl)methyl)-8-methyl-6,7,8,9-tetrahydro-3H-pyrazolo[4,3-f]isoquinolin-6-yl)-3-methoxyphenyl)azetidin-3-amine (169 mg, 0.39 mmol) and DIPEA (203 μL, 1.16 mmol) in NMP (1.7 mL) at room temperature. The resulting residue was purified by reverse phase flash chromatography (C18), eluting with decreasingly polar mixtures of water (containing 0.2% ammonium hydroxide) and MeCN as eluents.
